quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Teeth and Animals
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, network, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Windows Vista commercials have boasted of the Record Live Television capability of the operating system. What is necessary to use this function?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: TV Tuner Card

questions.question: Which of these animals have no teeth?
What is true about elephant tusks?

options.text: They are highly developed canine teeth.
They are not really made of ivory.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are highly developed incisors.

questions.question: Which of these people was a dentist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Revere

questions.question: The carbon atom in amino acids has four elements/groups attached to it in all amino acids (except for proline). Which of the following is not among these four?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Methyl group

questions.question: All mammalian amino acids have which Greek letter designating their relation to the carbon atom to which different groups are attached?
What is FireWire?

options.text: a method of transporting data between two digital devices
a peer to peer sharing website for music and file sharing

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a method of transporting data between two digital devices

questions.question: On average, only one baby in 10,000,000 is born with a tooth.
A rodents teeth will grow continuously for its entire lifetime.
This Microsoft operating system, formerly codenamed Blackcomb and Vienna, is intended to succeed Windows Vista.
Which of these animals only has molars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adult aardvarks

questions.question: If a wireless network is set up in a home, yet the signal is weak in certain areas, you may buy one of these to increase the existing signal strength.
Which of these are heterodonts?
Which mammal has the most teeth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The spinner dolphin

questions.question: What is the number of amino acids commonly associated with the mammalian protein?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Egg and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, weight, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How long does it take for a platypus egg to develop completely and hatch?

options.text: 28 days of internal formation and 10 days of external incubation
15 days of internal formation and 35 days of external incubation
24 hours of internal formation and 15 days of incubation
The eggs develop within 7 days in the mothers uterus and the babies are hatched almost immediately after laying

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28 days of internal formation and 10 days of external incubation

questions.question: What is the main protein found in the egg white?
Which of the following is not true about the bird eggshell?

options.text: The normal bird eggshell is porous.
The eggshell does not contain protein.
The eggshell consists of roughly 95% calcium carbonate crystals.
The bird eggshell is covered by a structure called cuticle.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The eggshell does not contain protein.

questions.question: Which of these expression does not refer to a yolkless egg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vain egg

questions.question: Which of the following is the Latin word for egg?
Select the incorrect statement.

options.text: Over 80 % of an elephants tusk is visible-the rest lies inside the gums.
Aside from the elephant, the walrus has the largest tusks.
The tusks of a male elephant grow about 18 cm a year.
Biologists have found that the tooths weight and its need for muscular development has greatly influenced the development of the mammalian skull.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over 80 % of an elephants tusk is visible-the rest lies inside the gums.

questions.question: The egg of this animal contains the largest existing single cell.
Consider all animals that ever lived. Which animal had the longest teeth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The straight-tusked elephant

questions.question: How many hours approximately does an eggshell formation take in an average laying hen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: About 20 hours

questions.question: Eggs have a very high nutrition value. Which of the following substances is not present within an egg?
Which of the following is not true about the egg yolk?

options.text: It contains 75% of the protein of the egg.
It is placed in a yolk sac.
Its usual color varies from pale yellow to deep orange.
It contains almost 100% of total amount of fat and cholesterol in the egg.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It contains 75% of the protein of the egg.

questions.question: What is the weight of the smallest known bird egg on the planet?
Every mammal has teeth.
The narwhale has two teeth in its upper jaw, one of which develops into a horn-like protrusion (this is true).
The most common  fossil is the tooth.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Skin and Water
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, computers, diseases. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which was the first version of Microsoft Windows to support Plug and Play?
Which of the following is correct?

options.text: Primates include Gorillas, Monkeys and Humans.  Monkeys include Pro-Simians and Chimpanzees.
Primates include Monkeys, Pro-Simians, and Apes.  Apes include Orangutans, Gorillas, Chimpanzees and Humans.
Primates include Apes and Pro-Simians.  Pro-Simians include Humans.  Apes include Gorillas, Orangutans and Monkeys.
Primates include Humans, Pro-Simians and Apes.  Apes include Orangutans, Gorillas, and Monkeys.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Primates include Monkeys, Pro-Simians, and Apes.  Apes include Orangutans, Gorillas, Chimpanzees and Humans.

questions.question: In their third generation computers flourished, thanks Jack St. Clair Kilbys and Robert Noyces independent invention.  What did they invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: integrated circuit (or microchip)

questions.question: If the optimal body habitus for hot climates is tall and slender, what is one possible condition explaining pygmies?
The Arecibo Observatory, located approximately 12 miles south-southwest from Arecibo, Puerto Rico, is notable for owning the worlds largest single-aperture telescope of this type.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Radio telescope

questions.question: Which of the following modern diseases evolved as a protection against malaria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sickle Cell Anemia

questions.question: This English mathematician, logician and cryptographer is widely regarded as the father of modern computer science.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Turing

questions.question: Which was the first implemented high-level general purpose programming language?
Which of the following primates is the closest related to humans?  (That is, this primate has more DNA in common with humans than any other living creature does.)

One famous analog computer was the water integrator, which functioned by manipulation of water through a room of pipes and pumps, where the water levels represented numbers, and the rate of flow represented mathematical operations.  Which country built the water integrator?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soviet Union

questions.question: Mitochondrial DNA has been analyzed to estimate the ancestral lineage of various species around the world, including primates.  Which of the following statements about mitochondria is true?

options.text: Mitochondria function in the cell to break down waste products.
Mitochondria are descended from once-separate, single-celled organisms which invaded a cell, stuck around, then lost their ability to live independently.
Mitochondrial DNA is only inherited by males.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitochondria are descended from once-separate, single-celled organisms which invaded a cell, stuck around, then lost their ability to live independently.

questions.question: Dark skin contains melanin, which is a dark pigment in the skin.  The purpose for melanin is to protect the skin from harmful effects of ultraviolet sunlight, which include skin cancer.  What evolutionary advantage does light skin have?

options.text: Light skin lets in more sunlight, which allows a person in colder climates to get warm more easily.
Light skin lets in more sunlight.  Sunlight catalyzes the formation of Vitamin D.
Light skin tans more easily.  This makes the person more attractive and therefore facilitates mating.
Light skin is more attractive, which makes the person better able to attract a mate.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Light skin lets in more sunlight.  Sunlight catalyzes the formation of Vitamin D.

questions.question: This computer engineer and co-founder of Apple Computer is often credited with developing the first mass-market home computers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Woz Wozniak

questions.question: African Americans are more likely to suffer from hypertension (high blood pressure) than European Americans.  Why?

options.text: Enslaved individuals were transported from Africa in the holds of ships, and given very little water.  Those whose bodies conserved salt were more likely to survive the journey.  Salt exacerbates high blood pressure.
African Americans eat more salty food than European Americans do.

In tropical climates, one sweats a lot.  This results in water loss, which lowers blood pressure.  Africans therefore conserve salt more efficiently than Europeans.  In the United States, however, where it is cooler, this characteristic leads to high bloo

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enslaved individuals were transported from Africa in the holds of ships, and given very little water.  Those whose bodies conserved salt were more likely to survive the journey.  Salt exacerbates high blood pressure.

questions.question: In the 1950s, these electronic components replaced vacuum tubes in the production of computers.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Sun and Observatory
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, kind, space. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these islands is known as the location of numerous important world observatories?
The Sun is located at the center of our galaxy.
The Yerkes Observatory in Williams Bay, Wisconsin, established in 1897 by George Ellery Hale, works with a 102 cm (40 inch) refracting telescope.
NASAs Chandra space observatory launched on July 23, 1999 uses what type of telescopes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: X-ray telescopes

questions.question: All planets, comets and asteroids orbit around the Sun.  What percentage of the Solar Systems mass does the Sun account for?
The main purpose of the observatory located on the north shore of Big Bear Lake in the San Bernardino Mountains, California is studying what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sun

questions.question: The Hubble Space Telescope in orbit around the Earth has become one of the most important telescopes in the history of astronomy since its launch in 1990. It doesnt work in which one of these wavelength regimes?
The surface temperature of the Sun is 5,780 K, which makes it white.  Why does the Sun appear yellow from the surface of the Earth?

options.text: because of the distance the light travels
because of the blue color of the sky
because of our eyes inability to see light  in that range

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because of the blue color of the sky

questions.question: Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory is a complex of astronomical telescopes and instruments, located on the territory of which country?
The Very Large Array (VLA) is a radio astronomy observatory located on the Plains of San Augustin, USA, consisting of what number of separate radio antennae?
Which of the following historical sites did not serve as a kind of observatory in the past?

options.text: The Great Sphinx of Giza, Egypt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Sphinx of Giza, Egypt

questions.question: The Sun was once regarded as a small and insignificant star, but is now believed to be brighter than approximately 85% of the stars in the galaxy.
The Sun is a main sequence star and as such generates energy by this process, joining hydrogen nuclei together into helium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: nuclear fusion

questions.question: This observatory, located at Mauna Kea, Hawaii, uses two telescopes equipped with adaptive optics.

options.text: Observatorio Nacional de Llano del Hato

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W. M. Keck Observatory

questions.question: This tasteless, colorless and odorless chemical element makes up most of the Suns volume (approx. 92%).

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Members and Body
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, cartilages, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the most diverse and abundant group of organisms on Earth. Its members reproduce so fast that they can double their number as quickly as every 10 minutes.
Name the longest bone in the body.
Most cultures have a solar diety, someone who represents the Sun.  Who is the chief solar diety in Hinduism?
The members of only one of these types of microorganisms have a cell nucleus. Which are they?
Which of the following is the natural habitat of the bacteria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The scapula is part of the spine near the hip.
What is referred to as the solar apex?

options.text: the highest point the Sun reaches during the day
the warmest day of the year as measured on the equator
the direction the Sun travels through space
the highest UV reading taken from the earths surface

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the direction the Sun travels through space

questions.question: Which of these is an efficient way to save trees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Using less electricity

questions.question: In an average household, on a daily basis most people forget the fan or lights on?

Ancient Greek astronomer Aristarchus was the first person to present the theory that the sun is at the center of the solar system (heliocentrism).  However in the 16th century, this Polish astronomer was first to formulate a scientifically based heliocentric study.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicolaus Copernicus

questions.question: A virus is a unicellular infectious agent consisting of genetic material encapsulated in a protective protein coat.
The largest semilunar cartilages, also called the menisci, are located in this part of the body.
What is the most common reason for water waste?
This commercially available non-toxic gas makes up 25% of the Suns mass.  It is used in deep diving to reduce the effects of narcosis.
Name the ligament that attaches to the head of the femur and the acetabulum.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ligamentum Teres

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Mars and Surface
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, astronomer, valles. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can you donate any electrical items to a recycling dump place?
Located along the Martian equator, Valles Marineris is a canyon much bigger than the Grand Canyon on Earth. How long is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4,000 km long.

questions.question: The atmosphere of Mars is mostly composed of what element?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carbon Dioxide

questions.question: What astronomer was the first to see canali on the surface of Mars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giovanni Shiaparelli

questions.question: The water bottle is the most popular type of drink container found in garbage cans.
Fibromyalgia is most common in women.
Mars has the tallest known mountain in the Solar System. What is its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Olympus Mons

questions.question: What was the name of the first spacecraft to study Mars?
Can you recycle food scraps?
The planet Mars is named after which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman God of War

questions.question: Which of these can help produce pencils, without cutting down trees?
When was fibromyalgia recognized as an illness by the American Medical Association?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the 1980s

questions.question: What type of weather pattern on Mars can obscure the surface from view?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dust Storms

questions.question: Mars takes about how many Earth days to travel once around the Sun?
Mars has two natural satellites. What are their names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phobos and Deimos
